conversation.message: Dear School_B admissions team, I’m Student_A. School_B is one of my top choices because I value a rigorous academic environment and I’m ready to contribute actively to classes and school life. I would be excited to enroll if admitted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D, but I have the lowest priority there, so an immediate apply is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. To maximize my final outcome, I should apply to my next-best option where I have a strong priority position. At School_A, I am ranked 4th (behind E, C, D), so acceptance is uncertain. At School_B, I am ranked 2nd (behind Student_D), giving me a high chance to secure a match at a highly preferred school before capacity fills. Therefore I will apply to School_B now with a clear, committed message.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing our current applicant pool and priorities for this cycle, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time.

We truly appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in the rest of the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_A is #2 on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_D). In round 1, only Student_A applied to us, so accepting now would secure a high-ranked match. However, Student_D ranks School_B as their #2 choice (after School_D) and may apply to us if not accepted by School_D; similarly Student_B ranks us #3. Since our quota is 1, accepting Student_A now could forgo a chance at Student_D, our top choice. Given School_D’s top priority is Student_B and many students rank School_D first, Student_D might not get School_D and could come to us soon. Therefore, strategically reject now to keep the seat available for Student_D, even though it risks ending unmatched if Student_D never applies.

conversation.message: Hello School_D admissions team—I'm Student_B. I’m very interested in joining School_D and would like to formally apply. I believe I would be a strong fit and I’m ready to commit if accepted.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E, but School_E’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_A, Student_D, Student_E). With capacity 1, applying now is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply. In contrast, School_D is my 4th choice but ranks me 1st in its priority list, so an early [APPLY] should secure a guaranteed match. Given the goal is to maximize my outcome and avoid being left with an even worse option later, I will lock in School_D now.

conversation.message: Student_B, thank you for your application. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_D. Please confirm your commitment to enroll so we can finalize your spot in our incoming class. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Inbox includes B, C, D, E all applying. School_D true priority ranking is B > D > E > C > A, so Student_B is our top choice. Accepting B immediately secures the best possible match for us; there is no benefit to waiting since no one outranks B on our list. Student_B ranks School_D 4th, but they explicitly state readiness to commit if accepted, so acceptance should finalize the match and remove risk of losing the top priority candidate.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions Committee—I'm Student_C, and School_D is my first-choice school. I’m strongly committed to enrolling if admitted because I value the academic environment and would prioritize School_D above all other options. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. An early, clear application signals commitment and may help if School_D has any discretion beyond strict priority or if higher-priority students pursue other schools first.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your thoughtful application and for sharing your strong interest in School_D. At this time, we have already filled our available seat and are unable to extend an offer. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best with your other applications. [REJECT]

Even aside from the rule, Student_C is ranked below Student_B on our priority list, so we would not displace the current match.
